description: Rules for extracting SIZE (quantity) from product title
instructions: Extract the QUANTITY (size number) from the title. This can be: (1) Discrete units like '60 capsules' → size=60, (2) Weight amounts like '2 lbs' → size=2, or (3) Volume amounts like '8 fl oz' → size=8. Look for numbers before unit keywords. Be careful NOT to confuse dosage (mg, IU) with size.

examples.title: Fish Oil 1000mg 180 Softgels
examples.reasoning: Found '180 softgels' - the size is 180 (not 1000, which is dosage)

examples.title: Vitamin D 5000 IU 60 Capsules
examples.reasoning: Found '60 capsules' - the size is 60 (not 5000, which is dosage in IU)

examples.title: Elderberry Syrup 8 fl oz
examples.reasoning: Found '8 fl oz' - the size is 8 (volume measurement)

examples.title: Whey Protein Powder 2 lbs
examples.reasoning: Found '2 lbs' - the size is 2 (weight measurement, will be converted to OZ)

examples.title: Creatine Monohydrate 500 g
examples.reasoning: Found '500 g' - the size is 500 grams (will be converted to OZ)

examples.title: Multivitamin Gummy
examples.reasoning: No size information found in title

warnings: CRITICAL: Do NOT confuse dosage numbers (mg, mcg, IU, mcg/ml) with size.
CRITICAL: Look for the number that comes BEFORE unit keywords (capsules, tablets, softgels, oz, lbs, g, kg).
CRITICAL: For weight/volume products (powder, liquid), EXTRACT the weight/volume number as size.
CRITICAL: If you see multiple numbers, choose the one associated with units, NOT dosage.
Example: 'CoQ10 100mg 60 Capsules' → Size is 60 (not 100, not 10 from CoQ10)
Example: 'Whey Protein 2 lbs' → Size is 2 (extract the weight number)
Example: 'Creatine 500g' → Size is 500 (extract the weight number)
